title: Part 1: Can we keep our differences aside & save our ONLY home?
body:
I am writing this today from the trenches, it has been a 5 year long journey, down a tunnel to rebuild this world, many called us too ambitious, told this is too big a challenge.

## Fighting climate change ? You will need an army for that.

Yes, this army is what we seek, band of brothers & sisters. The army of the planet filled with Earthlings - all colors, skin, culture and beliefs. We as a *race* are at a turning point. **Humanity as we know will endure pain in billions in the next 3 decades and beyond if we do not act.**

## We need to Act.

Consider this a rally call.

Keep differences aside for a while and save this home we have created on Earth. Make no mistake Earth will endure this, it is Us the stewards who will be replaced. I do not want this to be my ending, not the ending of my children.

I know it is the same for all of you as well. From one human heart to all the other human hearts reading this. Are we all that different? Donâ€™t we all want the same things?

To be happy, to be loved by friends and family. To enjoy this life and everything it has to offer - nice air to breathe, good water to drink, food to eat and pets to love. If this is all, what we all seek for the most part - why are we all so hell bent on robbing it from one another?

Our planet has **enough** for all of us, only, only if we change a few things that **we do**.For a species, We humans have gone to the moon, send robots to Mars, for such magical creatures like us, a small course correction is not going to be hard. It is possible!

When is it possible?

**When we keep our differences apart**. All of us have wronged each other. I have wronged so many wonderful people in my life, some knowingly and some unknowingly.

## I am sorry for each and every one of you. All 8 Billion of you.

Our ancestors have killed each other, robbed and cheated each other. We have done the same. Scores cannot be settled. Covid-19 first and now Climate Change is reminding us that what happens in one part of the world has an impact on the other.

Can we all have a dialogue?  
 We all see the climate change, our waters drying & our food getting scarce.

## Can we do a course correction? Can we keep our difference aside, and save our home?

It is time to pen down everything I have endured, learned and solved along with thousands driven just like me, we are in the trenches and we need Help.

**Help us course correct, it begins with the courage to say, the courage to say that 8 Billion self actualized humans at the same time collaborating is possible. Think about the progress and prosperity we can build.**

We have a whole universe out there, for the *explorers* among us to venture into, and a loving planet for those in us who want to *nurture*.

Let us make the Internet era, go down in the history as the age where humanity for the first time realized, how small a band of 8 Billion we humans are. There are over 200 Billion planets out there in the universe, compared to that how small is 8 Billion humans? We are special & rare, let us treat each other like that.

End of the day, what do we all want our legacy to be? Do we course correct to build a golden age of co-operation or will we go down as fossil fuel, made from our own bickering? 

This is a rally call brothers & sisters, from the trenches. 

We need you.

title: Bamboo Building
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1K90Iz-l3gNtN_iH-MBRH.png?height=266&width=438)

After thinking about a place for a long time, I have a vague feeling of pain, as if it was a Dai village in my previous life, which I have been dreaming about. That is the place where I used to work and live for eight years. A soft care.

The mountain wind blows the morning mist, like strips of white satin, gently and slowly, wrapping the scattered villages with a thin layer of soft yarn. The bamboo buildings with unique style and unique style are hidden by big banyan trees, mango orchards and coconut groves by the side of the village. When you look around, everything here is dyed emerald green.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/t1c6DXM1QLLBdplrVws3R.png?height=270&width=402)

Kapok on the edge of the village, with open arms, blooming with red buds, can't wait for the foil of green leaves to ignite the passion. Amorous peach blossoms, like pink clouds, are printed and dyed among the green trees, like the blush on the face of a shy girl, adding a bit of tenderness. The paddy field stretches out to the side of the mountain, blooming among the bamboo trees, and sketching among the paddy fields. The rice fields in spring are even more fascinating. When the industrious children of the Dai people plant the seedlings on the side of the mountain, they also endow the rice fields with extra beauty. The scattered rice fields are filled with clear mountain springs, such as the magic mirror scattered among the mountains of Ailao, reflecting the colorful clouds, splendid rainbows, everything in the world, and the most beautiful scenery in the world. The sun shines on the water, emitting sparkling waves. The vast tranquility and tranquility, the same mottled and overflowing reflection, is like a landscape painting, supporting a thick and dignified line of blue sky. Relying on diligence and intelligence, the Dai family has created a splendid imprint of civilization here. Pieces of rice fields connect the Dai villages, mountains and nature so harmoniously.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vgdMnAdP2COSuiS-pmgpS.png?height=266&width=414)

Stepping on the bamboo bridge, bypassing the water-filled stream, I was immersed in an ancient dream. There was a mist of rain in the sky, only the sound of the rain falling on the bananas, and only the light raindrops fell on the newly-haired green leaves and safflower, which made the natural green and red look so delicate. The drizzle was lingering, and the whole village was moistened. The green rain and fog lingered like a thin white veil, covering the strangeness of the village, but it also added a bit of mystery to the original beautiful scenery.

Standing on the bamboo building paved by Miba, the greenery of Bazi came to his eyes. Coconut groves are chasing green clouds, sugar cane overflows with mellow sweetness, and tea leaves are fragrant and intoxicating everywhere. There are dense greens everywhere, and green tides everywhere. Looking at the sky and the earth, occasionally a shadow of the mountains is revealed. Among the green waves, the big banyan trees that cover the ground, the verdant phoenix-tailed bamboos, and the fruit-bearing betel nut all decorate the charming Dai bamboo buildings.

Flowing quietly through the small river between the bamboo buildings, slapping the eternal dream of the bamboo buildings. The stockade was quiet. In the depths of the bamboo forest, a girl from the Dai family walked by carrying water, and her long tube skirt swayed with Ana's body. Dai girls are demons made of water, and water is the soul of the Dai family. The bamboo building is accompanied by water, and the sound of the spring is ding-dong, adding a kind of leisure, a kind of elegance, a kind of calm, not to mention the water here, and the bamboo building. Natural harmony, simple and beautiful bamboo building, inherits the gentleness of water and the eternity of spring!

The fragrance of dendrobium flowers fills the bamboo building, the cactus fence is full of flowers, the phoenix-tailed bamboo is rustling, the mango can be touched, and the grapefruit that bends the branches is beating against the eaves of the bamboo building. Walking into the bamboo building, the gentle and watery Dai girl will come slowly, bring a cup of glutinous rice fragrant tea, gently put the tea down, and then smile. The colorful tube skirt, the fragrant breath, the faint tea fragrance, and the sweet smile, like a dancing peacock. Walking into the quiet and peaceful bamboo building, you will have the feeling of past life and present life. This feeling, as if traveling through the ancient time and space, waiting for thousands of years, fluttering in the heart.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2Z5BWaIQexkgD6shdN8pR.png?height=266&width=463)

The sunset is gradually melted away by the green, and the sunset is dressed in a light green and beautiful wedding, slowly pulling the full moon behind the mountain. Cicada Feather's moonlight slides from the roof to the balcony. The tall banana leaves slowly hold up Haoyue, the moon in Dai Village, savoring the green night sky, and feeling the vicissitudes of time. The rain forest is soft and moist, the coconut trees are slim, and the phoenix tails and bamboos are affectionate. Sitting on the balcony paved by Zhuba, the laughter washed away the exhaustion. At this time, the bamboo building is full of warmth, auspiciousness and happiness.

In the aroma of tea, the moonlight comes from the branches and leaves, and diffuses into the lake of people's hearts. The gurgling water in the bamboo forest, now reflected in the moonlight, looks particularly cool. The breeze is coming, and the night sky is filled with fragrant fragrance, which makes people excited, and the feeling of a lifetime is suddenly lifted. In the verdant phoenix-tailed bamboo forest in front of the bamboo building, Xiaobu's long and affectionate singing, accompanied by the chirping of insects, drifted far and far with the evening wind.

The gentle singing, flowing with the breath of the Dai family, is soft and soft, like a hand plucking your heartstrings, the original Dai family charm will always be lingering in my heart. At this time, the moon became charming and beautiful, and the Dai girl who was bathing by the river felt comfortable, shy, and laughter with silver bells. The brisk drum beats and the melodious sound of gongs flew to my ears. The girl from the Dai family who followed the sound walked towards the boy who was like a madman, dancing lightly on the moon, singing flowing water. The girls looked at their lover with honey-flowing eyes, and colorful sunlight flashed in their eyes. Shuangshuang hides under the big banyan tree, or sits in the banana bush, the flowers are fragrant, the moonlight is melting, and the two loving hearts turn into thousands of words to pour out their hearts. With a little relief, the bamboo building in the wind is slowly intoxicated.

The bamboo building under the moonlight is extraordinarily enchanting, and this bamboo building is an eternal witness. It reflects the tenderness and the vicissitudes of life. On such a moonlit night, sitting quietly in front of the window of the bamboo building, the night wind blows the bamboo forest, The moonlight and the singing meet, and at this time, there is a quiet mood, which dissolves in the emotion of life like a dream.

The bamboo building under the moonlight and the bamboo building in the wind have also become my soft concern. The moon is still full of fantasy, people have been separated by thousands of mountains and rivers, but the same deep thoughts.

title: #Winning
body:
This week I had planned to write on the topic of doxing, or more specifically, about the question of â€œto dox or not to doxâ€, and the choice for, or against, web3 anonymity. As inspired as I initially felt to explore it, once I sat down to outline it the work began to feel like a grind. Then, as I often do these days when feeling stuck, I turned my attention to twitter for a daily download of crypto news and DAOist musings. Somewhere in my feed, from someone I had never heard of, there appeared the following,

â€œYou are the average of the 5 people you spend the most time with.
Thatâ€™s why every quarter, I evaluate myself and my friends on 3 key criteria:

* Income
* Fitness
* Influence

Anyone who scores below me is cut off.
Complacency is the first step towards mediocrity.â€

A day later, though I donâ€™t recall all the details of my reaction, I think it a safe bet it included some combination of a furrowed brow, my best [gas face](https://gfycat.com/decimalreasonableanophelesmosquito) and nausea.  All of that before I fired back with the first thing to come to mind as a counter blow.

â€œCongratulations on a life devoid of either giving or receiving unconditional love. Youâ€™re winning though. ğŸ‘Šâ€

[https://twitter.com/HAshBrown_27/status/1548437771974348801?s=20&t=4QqD9qeeewCOpN7zYUJ16g](https://twitter.com/HAshBrown_27/status/1548437771974348801?s=20&t=4QqD9qeeewCOpN7zYUJ16g)

Soon after that I turned off my computer and went out for the day. Honestly, I donâ€™t think it occurred to me that I would even look at the tweet again. To the contrary, as someone new to twitter this year, I expected my response would go largely ignored, joining my 20-or-so other tweets in the land of twitter oblivion. To my surprise though, when I returned home several hours later, I noticed my twitter notification bell ringing, alerting me to the fact that my response had close to 200 likes. 20 hours later that number is now up to 488. Not that Iâ€™m counting.

Iâ€™m new to this twitter thing, and as far as â€œlikesâ€ are concerned, have only facebook likes of posts of my kids, mountain views and fishing pictures to compare it to. 488 likes seems like a lot though. So while it may be small potatoes to seasoned tweeters with big followings, Iâ€™m a babe in the woods here, feeling pretty proud of that 488 thank you very much. Ooh, lookie there, just shot past 500. Am I going viral? LFG!!!

Seriously though, upon looking into the phenomena of my most-liked social media entry ever, I see the person I responded to has a lot of followers. 6,075 to be exact. And digging a little deeper I realize he likely intended his tweet as satire. Gas face rescinded. Perhaps the joke is on me for responding to it.

Satire or not, and irrespective of whether his friendship circles have anything to do with crypto and Web3, [@_mihir](https://twitter.com/__mihir?s=20&t=iOpvhasWZtEkPYiiXfkDYw) points to something very concerning to me about Web3 culture and the playing field of web3 identity. Playas gonna play. So how will Web3 define winning?

Before we get into all that I sense some context would be helpful.  A man in my early 50â€™s, I am at most a social media dabbler. I have a facebook page that I post on occasionally and to keep up with the lives of my 926 friends. I have created a few blogs over the years that I have enjoyed writing on but never broadcasted. Instagram? Ohhh hellll noâ€¦.except to check in on the lives of my college-age children. I regard the notion of creating a web â€œidentityâ€ as near hostile to my bias for real-life interaction with others and time outdoors. And other than a short list of physical ailments, I canâ€™t think of anything Iâ€™d like less than â€œfollowersâ€.

So what am I doing here worrying and writing about Web3 culture?  Fair question. What can I say except [orange pills](https://ryanslot.substack.com/p/what-it-means-to-be-orange-pilled#details) are a thing. [Green pills](https://www.forbes.com/sites/kylewestaway/2022/06/16/how-crypto-can-regenerate-the-world/?sh=7ed83b602fd3) too. Iâ€™ve fallen down a [crypto rabbit hole](https://garywoodfine.com/going-down-the-crypto-rabbit-hole/) and I canâ€™t get up!

The truth is that while I wrestle with mixed emotions about getting involved, I am thankful for cryptoâ€™s role in opening my mind (ğŸ¤¯) and luring me beyond my comfort zone.  For every horror story of greed, theft and exploitation related to this new frontier, I find most of what I read about the space to be inspiring.  To quote the immortal words of Buffalo Springfield, [â€œSomethings Happening Hereâ€](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rQUj56sqicU), 2020â€™s style, and most days I want to be a part of it.

One example of this is an article, [â€œThe Future of Workâ€](https://newsletter.banklesshq.com/p/the-future-of-work), by David Hoffman. David makes a strong case for why Digital Organizations (DOâ€™s), enabled by the blockchain and tokenized incentives, will present unprecedented opportunities for humans to coordinate both our heartsâ€™ and mindsâ€™ shared interests to do purposeful work together.  Among the many lines to strike a chord with me David writes,

â€œIf you are a young person, looking for purpose, meaning, and eventually a salary, establishing yourself as a strong DOer is one of the best footholds you can establish for yourselfâ€¦.If you believe DOs are the future, you should start DOing now, so that you become the scarce resource for both DOs and people who need help DOing.â€

Relative to the audience David likely had in mind I am not a â€œyoung personâ€. That said, aside from a rather curmudgeonly attitude toward social media, I pride myself at being young in spirit. I am DOing (and DAOing) now and, in time, aspire to be among the scarce, most valued resources of the space. So what game am I playing? And what was it about @_mihirâ€s tweet that bothered me so?

Though it has been over 20 years since I worked as an equity analyst at an investment brokerage firm, that work, and my short time in the industry, taught me some valuable lessons. The most memorable of them is the difference between the â€œgameâ€ of judging companiesâ€™ worth on the basis of quarterly performance vs. that of valuing them (or not) on the basis of fundamental strengths relative to longer-term investment horizons. The former game is played to generate transactions that pay brokers and their firms. The latter is played to maximize investorsâ€™ returns.

Web3 playing fields, DOs and DAOs included, will create whole new worlds from which to relate to the earth, token projects, and one another. There will be more games to go around than anyone can count in the spaceâ€™s many arenas. Short-term trading, of crypto and people, can be fun, even profitable. Patient investment, in the people and projects that mean the most to us, can change the world. Web3 only wins by changing the world.

title: The Market Rebounds: Has Cryptocurrency Become Bullish?
body:
As of July 15, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index shows that the market has been suffering from â€œExtreme Fearâ€ for 70 consecutive days, a record high. Although it seems thatÂ the market hasnâ€™t been so volatile in July, it remains fundamentally bearish, and the bankruptcy of top institutions did create negative market sentiments. To date, U.S. CPI soared 9.1% over the past year, the largest increase since November 1981, and global finance continues to suffer from a liquidity crunch.

As the market has just gone through a deleveraging campaign with far-reaching implications, cryptos like BTC and ETH fell below their price peaks recorded during the last market cycle. However, the market has gradually absorbed the panic impact, and there have been signs of a market rebound. According to CoinEx, a crypto exchange, the BTC price recently returned to over $22,000.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wO0DXmTsUAKNaHSAkyGT1.png?height=493&width=1280)

ETH, on the other hand, hit $1,500. It should be noted that in the last bear-bull cycle, the market recovery was also driven by increases in the ETH price.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pTfoKMP028yH3ONXF9OmN.png?height=507&width=1280)

As Bitcoin and Ethereum record consecutive price growths, DeFi tokens have also become more valuable. Does this mean that a new market cycle has started? Letâ€™s take a closer look at the current market in terms of active addresses, the inflow/outflow of money, and market fundamentals. As BTC and ETH led market recoveries during previous cycles, we will examine the relevant statistics of the two.

According to on-chain data, Bitcoinâ€™s active addresses increased by 2.44% in the past seven days, and the number of zero balance addresses went up by 5.92%.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qGACWxcZH4ubCgSuSoqnl.png?height=527&width=1280)

Ethereumâ€™s active addresses, on the other hand, grew by 9.98% in the past seven days, and the number of zero balance addresses went down by 3.05%. Meanwhile, on July 18, the number of addresses holding at least 1 ETH hit 1,554,716, an all-time high.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xVu3CIbRttcxPnZ3jXvgj.png?height=534&width=1280)

In terms of the inflow/outflow of money, although both BTC and ETH come with positive inflows, the latter shows stronger momentum.

![Historical In/Out of the Money (BTC)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9B4p_KL-8i1dvFntL68A_.png?height=544&width=1280)

![Historical In/Out of the Money (ETH)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ci0w-pAbJvUOsAgSoHPJa.png?height=585&width=1280)

Based on the current round of price growth, Ethereum has indeed outperformed Bitcoin. It is reported that Bitcoinâ€™s third largest whale has made multiple outgoing transfers since the early morning of July 19. As of this writing, the address has transferred 15,500 bitcoins that are worth about $350 million.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AEqqYQBILotqfncKuiF5N.png?height=172&width=1280)

Letâ€™s now turn to the fundamentals. As global finance faces a liquidity crunch, the crypto market hasnâ€™t been able to stay intact. The market panicked when crypto companies collapsed one after another a while back. However, the deleveraging caused by the liquidity crisis has also optimized the internal capital structure of the market and excluded more hot money. At the same time, new institutional investors are making a push into cryptocurrency.

According to the information disclosed so far, 40 fundraisings happened last week, and a16z and Sequoia Capital both took action. In particular, the scale of these fundraisings was small, with only three projects raising over $50 million. A report by The Block Research shows that the amount of VC investment in the blockchain space has declined for the first time since Q2 2020. The figure stood at $9.8 billion in Q2 2022, down by approximately 22% compared with the last quarter. Although the market is picking up strength, the fundraising statistics show that institutions remain extremely prudent.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VDDIY_rhEEBTx9wi03K3f.png?height=720&width=1079)

Any industry that seeks growth must go through multiple market cycles. From 2000 to 2002, the dot.com bubble triggered a bear market due to excessive valuations and speculations, but this did not affect its subsequent growth. Todayâ€™s crypto market is just the same. The momentary setbacks will help it find better growth drivers in the future.

As the crypto industry advances, all kinds of new functions and categories have emerged. Meanwhile, the entry threshold has kept going up, which has discouraged many who hope to join the crypto market. While everyone in the crypto space is working on more new functions, one exchange called CoinEx is striving to â€œslim downâ€ its products. To impress the world with the efforts made by the crypto market, the team is making many complex projects and tools more user-friendly. The exchange intends to make crypto trading easier and welcome investors from all sectors to the crypto space.

Todayâ€™s cryptocurrency, like the Internet, exists to make the world a better place.

title: The Market Rebounds: Has Cryptocurrency Become Bullish?
body:
As of July 15, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index shows that the market has been suffering from â€œExtreme Fearâ€ for 70 consecutive days, a record high. Although it seems thatÂ the market hasnâ€™t been so volatile in July, it remains fundamentally bearish, and the bankruptcy of top institutions did create negative market sentiments. To date, U.S. CPI soared 9.1% over the past year, the largest increase since November 1981, and global finance continues to suffer from a liquidity crunch.

As the market has just gone through a deleveraging campaign with far-reaching implications, cryptos like BTC and ETH fell below their price peaks recorded during the last market cycle. However, the market has gradually absorbed the panic impact, and there have been signs of a market rebound. According to CoinEx, a crypto exchange, the BTC price recently returned to over $22,000.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wO0DXmTsUAKNaHSAkyGT1.png?height=493&width=1280)

ETH, on the other hand, hit $1,500. It should be noted that in the last bear-bull cycle, the market recovery was also driven by increases in the ETH price.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pTfoKMP028yH3ONXF9OmN.png?height=507&width=1280)

As Bitcoin and Ethereum record consecutive price growths, DeFi tokens have also become more valuable. Does this mean that a new market cycle has started? Letâ€™s take a closer look at the current market in terms of active addresses, the inflow/outflow of money, and market fundamentals. As BTC and ETH led market recoveries during previous cycles, we will examine the relevant statistics of the two.

According to on-chain data, Bitcoinâ€™s active addresses increased by 2.44% in the past seven days, and the number of zero balance addresses went up by 5.92%.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qGACWxcZH4ubCgSuSoqnl.png?height=527&width=1280)

Ethereumâ€™s active addresses, on the other hand, grew by 9.98% in the past seven days, and the number of zero balance addresses went down by 3.05%. Meanwhile, on July 18, the number of addresses holding at least 1 ETH hit 1,554,716, an all-time high.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xVu3CIbRttcxPnZ3jXvgj.png?height=534&width=1280)

In terms of the inflow/outflow of money, although both BTC and ETH come with positive inflows, the latter shows stronger momentum.

![Historical In/Out of the Money (BTC)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9B4p_KL-8i1dvFntL68A_.png?height=544&width=1280)

![Historical In/Out of the Money (ETH)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ci0w-pAbJvUOsAgSoHPJa.png?height=585&width=1280)

Based on the current round of price growth, Ethereum has indeed outperformed Bitcoin. It is reported that Bitcoinâ€™s third largest whale has made multiple outgoing transfers since the early morning of July 19. As of this writing, the address has transferred 15,500 bitcoins that are worth about $350 million.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AEqqYQBILotqfncKuiF5N.png?height=172&width=1280)

Letâ€™s now turn to the fundamentals. As global finance faces a liquidity crunch, the crypto market hasnâ€™t been able to stay intact. The market panicked when crypto companies collapsed one after another a while back. However, the deleveraging caused by the liquidity crisis has also optimized the internal capital structure of the market and excluded more hot money. At the same time, new institutional investors are making a push into cryptocurrency.

According to the information disclosed so far, 40 fundraisings happened last week, and a16z and Sequoia Capital both took action. In particular, the scale of these fundraisings was small, with only three projects raising over $50 million. A report by The Block Research shows that the amount of VC investment in the blockchain space has declined for the first time since Q2 2020. The figure stood at $9.8 billion in Q2 2022, down by approximately 22% compared with the last quarter. Although the market is picking up strength, the fundraising statistics show that institutions remain extremely prudent.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VDDIY_rhEEBTx9wi03K3f.png?height=720&width=1079)

Any industry that seeks growth must go through multiple market cycles. From 2000 to 2002, the dot.com bubble triggered a bear market due to excessive valuations and speculations, but this did not affect its subsequent growth. Todayâ€™s crypto market is just the same. The momentary setbacks will help it find better growth drivers in the future.

As the crypto industry advances, all kinds of new functions and categories have emerged. Meanwhile, the entry threshold has kept going up, which has discouraged many who hope to join the crypto market. While everyone in the crypto space is working on more new functions, one exchange called CoinEx is striving to â€œslim downâ€ its products. To impress the world with the efforts made by the crypto market, the team is making many complex projects and tools more user-friendly. The exchange intends to make crypto trading easier and welcome investors from all sectors to the crypto space.

Todayâ€™s cryptocurrency, like the Internet, exists to make the world a better place.

title: HashKey DID Cooperates with OneCash on KYA
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KGyD27cxYSrd4MQDU7rpG.png?height=512&width=1024)

Asian Leading compliant stablecoin provider **OneCash** has pragmatically become the first KYC Provider of Web3 identifier **HashKey DID**, to collaborate on on-chain compliance issues, and to do Know Your Address(KYA) verification for payment addresses.

**About HashKey DID**

HashKey DID is a decentralized storage-featured Web 3.0 identifier that is underpinned by NFT- and smart contract-based privacy-preserving technology. As an important Web3 infrastructure of the HashKey ecosystem, the fundamental goal of HashKey DID is to build a community-governed HashKey DID DAO together with users.

**About OneCash**

OneCash is a stablecoin centered global financial technology platform that emphasizes compliance, security, and efficiency. We envision the world of fiat and cryptos would integrate seamlessly, and endeavor to create a world where cross-border trades can be effectively settled at low or no cost.
